steps.dialogue: Look at these two bars. One third is shaded on the left. Two sixths is shaded on the right. Do they show the same amount?
steps.prompt: Compare one third and two sixths. Are they equivalent?

workspace.description: Strip divided into thirds with 1 section shaded
Strip divided into sixths with 2 sections shaded

options.text: No, because six is larger than three.
No, because you can't compare fractions with different denominators.
Yes, because the shaded amounts cover the same length on both bars.
Yes, because one third is always equal to two of something.

correct_answer.context: The shaded portions occupy the same length on both bars, demonstrating that 1/3 and 2/6 are equivalent fractions

steps.success_path_dialogue: Correct. One third and two sixths are equivalent.
